image.altText: A man in a suit walks along a street.

items.synopsis: A jury finds Juan Daniel Visagie guilty of causing a brain injury to his daughter that eventually led to her death.

title.children: Perth father guilty of manslaughter over baby daughter's death

image.altText: A man holds the fin of a beached whale

items.synopsis: A pod of pilot whales has once again become stranded on a beach in southern Western Australia, despite painstaking attempts to herd them out to deeper water.

title.children: Pod of whales beached again after painstaking attempts to save them

image.altText: composite macron blinken

items.synopsis: Two of the world's most powerful leaders have used speeches in the Pacific to reaffirm their countries' commitment to the region, as geopolitical competition intensifies.

title.children: Macron warns of 'Chinese naval bases' in New Caledonia, as Blinken calls out 'problematic' Beijing during Tonga trip

image.altText: A young boy smiles at the camera while holding two Irish flags ahead of a match at the Women's World Cup.

items.synopsis: The Olympic champions Canada need a win against Ireland, but there is plenty of support for the girls in green in Perth. Earlier, Spain thrash Zambia at Eden Park and Japan beat Costa Rica at the Women's World Cup. Follow live.

title.children: Ireland, Canada wrap up day seven after Women's World Cup wins for Spain

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Five goals, three points, and qualification secured for both Spain and Japan with that victory. They play off against each other in Wellington/Te Whanganui-a-Tara on Monday July 31 to see who will finish top of the group - and who will pass their toughest challenge of the tournament to date. 5-0 is Spain's biggest victory at a Women's World Cup, and it could really have been quite a lot more. It's a shame for Zambia who never stopped working and had a couple of decent chances - but they were well beaten and have their keeper to thank that it didn't get closer to double figures. But they are out, as are Costa Rica.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Spain eases to victory over Zambia, Spain and Japan through to round of 16

children.content: Five goals, three points, and qualification secured for both Spain and Japan with that victory.
They play off against each other in Wellington/Te Whanganui-a-Tara on Monday July 31 to see who will finish top of the group - and who will pass their toughest challenge of the tournament to date.
(Getty Images)
5-0 is Spain's biggest victory at a Women's World Cup, and it could really have been quite a lot more.
It's a shame for Zambia who never stopped working and had a couple of decent chances - but they were well beaten and have their keeper to thank that it didn't get closer to double figures.
But they are out, as are Costa Rica.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: This one is very tight - about has tight as the hugely marginal offside that cruelled New Zealand yesterday. The ball is in the net, but the flag is up. But this one favours the attacking team! Alba Redondo looked like she might have been offside there, but the VAR official disagrees. She did well to control the ball, bringing it down and then composing herself before smashing it home. This time the referee gets her call right and the goal stands.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: 85' Spain has a fifth - and it's been taken off them - and now given back!

children.content: (Getty Images)
This one is very tight - about has tight as the hugely marginal offside that cruelled New Zealand yesterday.
The ball is in the net, but the flag is up.
(Getty Images)
But this one favours the attacking team!
Alba Redondo looked like she might have been offside there, but the VAR official disagrees.
(Getty Images)
She did well to control the ball, bringing it down and then composing herself before smashing it home.
This time the referee gets her call right and the goal stands.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Or do they? No, the flag has gone up but that looked very tight. It was Jenni Hermoso who slotted home on the rebound after a Zambia defender put a cross against her own post - narrowly avoiding scoring an own goal. Hermoso smashed home the rebound but the flag was raised - but now we're having a delay. "After review, no goal," says referee Hyeon-jeong Oh. "No offside. "No, no, no offside. Goal stands." Well I'm glad that's cleared up then... The goal stands, there was no offside and Spain has four. Something of an anticlimactic way to get your 50th international goal...
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: 71' Spain has another!

children.content: Or do they? No, the flag has gone up but that looked very tight.
It was Jenni Hermoso who slotted home on the rebound after a Zambia defender put a cross against her own post - narrowly avoiding scoring an own goal.
Hermoso smashed home the rebound but the flag was raised - but now we're having a delay.
"After review, no goal," says referee Hyeon-jeong Oh.
"No offside.
"No, no, no offside. Goal stands."
Well I'm glad that's cleared up then...
(Getty Images)
The goal stands, there was no offside and Spain has four.
Something of an anticlimactic way to get your 50th international goal...

image.altText: Chris Hipkins and Anthony Albanese standing at podiums at a press conference.

items.synopsis: Passport-free travel between Australia and New Zealand is still at least a year off, after talks between prime ministers Anthony Albanese and Chris Hipkins in Wellington.

title.children: Passport-free travel still a year off as Albanese sits down with New Zealand PM Hipkins

image.altText: People are seen in the lower part of the image wearing hard hats while the volcano erupts in the background.

items.synopsis: The trial over the deadly 2019 Whakaari White Island eruption has heard there was a 5 per cent chance multiple people would die during tours of the volcano.

title.children: One in 20 chance of a 'mass casualty event' on White Island, expert tells court

image.altText: Asian woman wearing black and white houndstooth jacket with sunglasses standing in front of a bronze lion.

items.synopsis: Australian man Chau Van Kham was released from a Vietnamese prison after serving four years of a 12-year sentence on terrorism charges this month. His lawyer, Dan Phuong Nguyen, has an incredible survival story of her own.

title.children: From refugee to human rights defender: The suburban lawyer who helped bring democracy activist Chau Van Kham home

image.altText: A bald man in black tshirt and woman with long dark hair and grey jumper work in a drycleaning facility surrounded by machinery.

items.synopsis: Inflation has slowed down again, with consumer prices up 6 per cent over the year to June, below most economists' forecasts and reducing the chance of an RBA rate rise next week.

title.children: Inflation falls faster than expected. Has the Reserve Bank already increased interest rates too far?

image.altText: Gordi Kirkbank-Ellis side-by-side with his brain scan

items.synopsis: The effect of head knocks over Gordi Kirkbank-Ellis's decades-long sporting career isn’t immediately obvious. That is, until you see what’s happening to his brain.

title.children: From the age of 4, Gordi played contact sports. See how it has impacted his brain

image.altText: The sign of a prison on a chain fence

items.synopsis: Police are preparing a report for the WA coroner after a prisoner died in custody near Derby on Monday.

title.children: WA prisoner dies after collapsing in custody

image.altText: An elderly man with a white beard looks stern.

items.synopsis: Bunbury resident Bob Barber says he and his wife would be "starving" without food support from organisations like Doors Wide Open and Foodbank.

title.children: This grandfather worked his whole life. Now he can't afford to buy groceries

image.altText: A close-up view of e-scooter wheels.

items.synopsis: The 15-year-olds were airlifted to Perth after colliding with a ute in Karratha. Police and doctors fear there will be more incidents to come.

title.children: Teens badly hurt in outback e-scooter crash as police grapple with reckless riding

image.altText: A man wearing a suit and tie

items.synopsis: Police say 31-year-old Mahmoud Abbas was shot by an unknown man outside a property in Greenacre this morning.

title.children: Sydney lawyer shot on same street where underworld figure was killed last year

image.altText: A young man wearing a grey hoodie.

items.synopsis: The court was shown graphic CCTV footage of an ambush by a rival gang that left teenager Declan Cutler dead on a footpath.

title.children: Feud between Melbourne youth gangs led to stabbing death of 16yo, court hears

image.altText: A man looking sideways

items.synopsis: Aboriginal leaders in the state's north say communities need more information before they cast their vote on the Voice to Parliament, as Indigenous electoral enrolment in WA increases significantly.

title.children: Indigenous electoral enrolment jumps in WA but opinion on the Voice remains mixed

image.altText: A woman wearing glasses talks into a microphone

items.synopsis: A 23-year-old man who sent a threatening message to author Yumi Stynes tells the media outside court he has a lot to do to "grow as a person".

title.children: Man who sent threatening message to Yumi Stynes apologises outside court

image.altText: Two giant solar panel car parks

items.synopsis: Almost 6,000 solar panels have been installed by Treasury Wine Estates, with the ability to generate more than 5,000 megawatt-hours of energy per year — the equivalent of powering around 900 homes.

title.children: Largest winery solar panel system in Australia switches on in the Barossa Valley

image.altText: A smiling Heather Barrett with a great sculpture of a horse

items.synopsis: The Rustic Farm Art Awards were created to help Perth hills communities heal after the Wooroloo bushfire destroyed 86 homes in 2021.

title.children: Hope rises from ashes of Wooroloo fire as community celebrates art awards

image.altText: Geoff and Rhonda doing a puzzle.

items.synopsis: Geoff is selectively mute and has a fragile X syndrome. When his mother engaged a disability service to take him to work, she didn't know it would use up almost all his NDIS funding.

title.children: Geoff was driven to work three days a week. He received a $700 invoice for it

image.altText: A house burnt by wildfire in the Sicilian village of Romitello

items.synopsis: Extreme weather has caused havoc across the Northern Hemisphere. Here's a look at how at how hardest-hit areas have been impacted by the current heatwave.

title.children: Hot-tub temperatures in Florida ocean and wild fires across Greece: See how the heatwave is playing out

image.altText: Photograph outside the Australian Tax Office headquarters

items.synopsis: Following an ABC Investigation, the Australian Tax Office admits criminals have fraudulently claimed more than $557 million from the Commonwealth using an identity loophole.

title.children: ATO admits identity loophole exposed by the ABC tops half a billion dollars

image.altText: Timothy Shea stands outside the glass doors of Manhattan federal court.

items.synopsis: A Colorado businessman receives the longest prison sentenced yet imposed over a fraudulent scheme to raise money for Donald Trump's border wall.

title.children: A non-profit raised millions for Trump's border wall. Here's why a third man behind the campaign has been sentenced

image.altText: An aerial shot of a coastal forest

items.synopsis: A year after it was initially scheduled to open to the public, construction is underway on the Wangetti Trail — designed to take hikers and mountain bikers through the Wet Tropics World Heritage Area between Cairns and Port Douglas.

title.children: Work finally begins on delayed 94km trail through World Heritage rainforest in Far North Queensland

image.altText: A man in a pink top smiling on a soccer pitch

items.synopsis: Soccer hasn't been a particularly popular sport in the United States, but its upward trajectory may be about to go stratospheric as Lionel Messi signs a lucrative deal with Inter Miami.

title.children: Messi spurned $2.4b so he could play soccer for David Beckham in Miami. Here's why it's a savvy move

image.altText: A person sits wearing black and looking serious while holding a report on a table.

items.synopsis: The survey, the first of its kind, shows nearly one in two young Indigenous LGBTIQA+ Australians have attempted suicide at some point in their life.

title.children: New report shines spotlight on 'shocking' rates of self-harm among young Indigenous LGBTIQA+ people

image.altText: A female footballer in a gold Australia jersey smiles and celebrates with her arm extended, celebrating a goal

items.synopsis: With Sam Kerr already on the sidelines, the Matildas lose Mary Fowler ahead of their clash with Nigeria in Brisbane.

title.children: Matildas lose another attacking weapon in crucial World Cup clash with Nigeria

image.altText: A composite image of two women.

items.synopsis: A childcare boss's decision after learning two of her staff had left a three-year-old on a bus in central Queensland for several hours has been credited with saving the girl's life.

title.children: Tears as women who left child on daycare bus sentenced over 'nightmare situation'

image.altText: Meta logo in background in focus with blurry silhouette heads in foreground.

items.synopsis: The Federal Court hears Meta used a free security app promoted as protecting data but the tech giant used it to find out "nearly everything" users were doing on their devices.

title.children: Free security app 'knows nearly everything' about users, court told as Facebook owners Meta fined $20m

image.altText: A palm tree has fallen onto a red tin building, with a white satellite dish on top and blue sky background

items.synopsis: Loyal customers have returned to their "green oasis in the desert", despite a record-breaking cyclone leaving it "a bunch of stumps".

title.children: After surviving a cyclone that blew away a helicopter hangar, Pardoo is facing hurdles to recovery

image.altText: A man wearing a mask

items.synopsis: Damian Wanstall, who previously taught maths at Kellyville High School, was unaware the person he was engaging with online in 2020 was actually an undercover police officer and was arrested when he arranged to meet.

title.children: 'He certainly had a sexual motivation': Former teacher jailed after online advert looking for young girl
